content: shell scarf crochet crochet this gorgeous scarf using any single ply sport or fingering weight yarn works up quick- ly and is an ideal project for beginners suggested yarns are brown sheep lanaloft solids or handpaints or crystal palace mini mochi noro kureyon or silk garden fingering weight yarn for fabulous color changing interest use a softly spun single ply yarn for best results this pattern is great for laceweight mohair yarn or handspun single-ply as well pocket meadow farm has a wide variety of these yarns so please come in call or check our website more photos online rating beginner/easy knowledge of basic crochet stitches reading charts needed materials 300 to 450 yards lightweight single ply yarn brown using f hook chain 28 work back and forth in row sheep lanaloft 145yds/50gr 3 balls or crystal palace row 1 2 double_crochet chain 1 2 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook repeat mini mochi 190yds/50gr 2 or 3 balls noro kureyon across chain 3 turn sock 450yds/100gr 1 ball or noro silk garden sock 350yds/100gr 1 ball us f crochet hook e for round 2 2 double_crochet chain 1 2 double_crochet in chain 1 space of shell cluster kureyon or size to obtain gauge on previous row repeat across 7 shell clusters chain 3 turn repeat row 2 for pattern gauge finishing exact gauge is not critical but work towards a slightly loose drapable fabric scarf will measure approximately soak in warm water rinse and block flat to shape add 6 x 60 not including fringe using 3 balls of lanaloft fringe to ends in groups of three strands per shell directions row 2 if fringe is desired cut 42 strands of yarn 12 long and set aside row 1 © ellen kardell/pocket meadow farm 2010 all rights reserved knitting fever www pocketmeadowfarm net po box 336 amityville ny 11701 off here s what i d like mirasol hacho 312
